C1 [ T ] to remove or take away someone or something: A move towards healthy eating could help eliminate heart disease.eliminate a possibility We eliminated the possibility that it could have been an accident.eliminate someone from something The police eliminated him from their enquiries.
C1 [ T often passive ] to defeat someone so that they cannot continue in a competition: He was eliminated in the third round of the competition.

[ T ] slang to murder someone: A police officer was accused of helping a drug gang eliminate rivals.
